name: Metformin
usage: First-line medication for type 2 diabetes, helps control high blood sugar
sideEffects: Nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, diarrhea, weakness, metallic taste in mouth

name: Insulin
usage: Used to manage blood sugar levels in patients with type 1 and type 2 diabetes
sideEffects: Hypoglycemia, allergic reaction, injection site reaction

name: Sulfonylureas
usage: Helps pancreas produce more insulin to lower blood sugar in type 2 diabetes
sideEffects: Hypoglycemia, upset stomach, skin rash or itching

name: DPP-4 inhibitors
usage: Helps improve A1C levels and blood sugar control in type 2 diabetes
sideEffects: Upper respiratory infections, sore throat, headaches, skin reactions

name: GLP-1 receptor agonists
usage: Helps control blood sugar levels in patients with type 2 diabetes
